bug.author: gscarella
bug.summary: Problem with LARS when successive calls
bug.description:
Hello, <denchmark-h:h3>Issue description</denchmark-h>
I have a problem with LARS when I make several successive solutions with it, in Lasso computations (for an Active Set method). One solution never ends and causes a memory leak (which is annoying) while the problem doesn't seem to be degenerated. It seems there happens a problem of numerical precision in LARS::Train, it gets stuck in the main loop. <denchmark-h:h3>My environment</denchmark-h>
mlpack version: 3.4.2 armadillo version: 9.900.4 boost version: 1.74.0 The problem was encountered on Linux (Ubuntu 20 and CentOS 7).
I join an example with a data file. <denchmark-h:h4>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
In the example, code should terminate and print "Computation completed" <denchmark-h:h4>Actual behavior</denchmark-h>
In the example, execution gets stuck and raises a memory leak at Neuron 7, iteration 3 Do you know a way to solve the problem ? Thanks G. Scarella <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/files/5636443/test_lars.cpp.txt>test_lars.cpp</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/files/5636435/data_field.bin.txt>data_field.bin</denchmark-link>
